column4: Can somebody help me why gparted shows my disk has 24gb left, but when I look under places choosing my harddisk it says 1.1gb free??
everything on one partition ?
try df at terminal
& Pelo: just a sec
& Pelo: take a look at this.. isnt something wrong? : http://11dem.dk/ubuntu/Screenshot.png
it's probably for ext3's purposes
like its reserving 24gb for ext3 purposes?
i'm thinking so
can I reconfigure that somehow? 1gig for anything should be more than enough?
do you know a way to fix this?
maybe disable ext3's journaling option ?
my root partition has 15 gb, currently 0.8 gb is "missing"
I figured out its ext3 by default reserves about 5% for superuser purposes.
but I kinda dont know how to remove that part :/
if ext3 developers make it like that, there's got to be a reason, don't mess with it
after all you have 475 gb left don't you ?
hehe thats only for the next hour. moving about 2tb and adding drives. just need to figure this out as i need the space
& Pelo: Rooy fixed my problem. Simple fix for future reference: tune2fs -m "percentage" (eg. 0) /dev/sdb1 . Thanks to you 2 guys aswell for trying
cheers!
anyway. was it you talking about symlinks?
no, ext3 journaling
ok maybe it was Pelo then. just need to know how they work
